skibidi_orm.query_engine.operations package

skibidi_orm.query_engine.operations.clauses module

Module representing differnet types of clauses present in where statement for example equal, greater than, …

skibidi_orm.query_engine.operations.crud module

The CRUD module provides classes for generating SQL statements for CRUD (Insert, Update, Delete) operations on database tables.

class skibidi_orm.query_engine.operations.crud.CRUDBase(obj: Model)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for generating SQL statements for INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE operations.

_obj

The model object associated with the CRUD operation.

Type:

Model

table() → str[source]

Returns the table name from the database.

Returns:

The table name.

Return type:

str

skibidi_orm.query_engine.operations.select module

Module describing SELECT statement.

Bases: object

The list of columns for grouping.

Indicates whether ordering is descending.

annotate(**kwargs: str | Function)[source]

Adds annotations to the query.

Parameters:

**kwargs – Keyword arguments representing annotations.

Returns:

The Select instance with annotations added.

Return type:

Select

Examples

Select(User).annotate(new_name=”original_column_name”)

property annotations

Get the annotations for query columns.

Returns:

The annotations for query columns.

Return type:

dict[str | Function, str]

property fields

Get the list of fields to select.

Returns:

The list of fields.

Return type:

list[str | Function]

filter(**kwargs: Any)[source]

Adds filter conditions to the query.

Possible options for filter conditions:

  • no option: equal

  • __gt: greater than

  • __gte: greater than or equal

  • __lt: less than

  • __lte: less than or equal

  • __not: not equal

  • __isnull: if True, is Null; if False, is not Null

Parameters:

**kwargs – Keyword arguments representing filter conditions.

Returns:

The Select instance with filter conditions added.

Return type:

Select

Examples

Select(User).filter(name=”Thom”, id__gt=1)

group_by(*args: str)[source]

Adds grouping to the query.

Parameters:

*args – list of columns for grouping.

Returns:

The Select instance with grouping added.

Return type:

Select

Examples

Select(User).group_by(“id”)

order_by(*args: str, desc: bool = False)[source]

Adds ordering to the query.

Parameters:

  • *args – list of columns for ordering.

  • desc (bool, optional) – Indicates whether ordering is descending. Defaults to False.

Returns:

The Select instance with ordering added.

Return type:

Select

Examples

Select(User).order_by(“id”, desc=True)

property order_by_col

Get the columns for ordering and the ordering direction.

Returns:

A tuple containing the columns for ordering and a boolean indicating the ordering direction.

Return type:

Tuple[list[str], bool]

property returning_model

Check if the query returns a model or specific columns.

Returns:

bool
